dependencies.description:
CFITSIO is a library of C and Fortran subroutines for reading and
writing data files in FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) data
format.
dependencies.name: cfitsio

dependencies.description:
ERFA (Essential Routines for Fundamental Astronomy) is a C library
containing key algorithms for astronomy.
dependencies.name: erfa

dependencies.description: Expat is an XML parser library written in C.
dependencies.name: expat

dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.
dependencies.name: pkgconfig

dependencies.description:
The Advanced Scientific Data Format (ASDF) is a next-generation
interchange format for scientific data. This package contains the Python
implementation of the ASDF Standard.
dependencies.name: py-asdf

dependencies.description:
IERS Earth rotation and leap second table Note: This package is not
meant for standalone purposes but is needed by AstroPy.
dependencies.name: py-astropy-iers-data

dependencies.description:
Beautiful Soup is a Python library for pulling data out of HTML and XML
files. It works with your favorite parser to provide idiomatic ways of
navigating, searching, and modifying the parse tree.
dependencies.name: py-beautifulsoup4

dependencies.description: Package provides Binary-, RedBlack- and AVL-Trees in Python and Cython.
dependencies.name: py-bintrees

dependencies.description: An easy whitelist-based HTML-sanitizing tool.
dependencies.name: py-bleach

dependencies.description: A collection of fast NumPy array functions written in Cython.
dependencies.name: py-bottleneck

dependencies.description:
Certifi: A carefully curated collection of Root Certificates for
validating the trustworthiness of SSL certificates while verifying the
identity of TLS hosts.
dependencies.name: py-certifi

dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.
dependencies.name: py-cython

dependencies.description: Dask is a flexible parallel computing library for analytics.
dependencies.name: py-dask

dependencies.description:
The extension-helpers package includes convenience helpers to assist
with building Python packages with compiled C/Cython extensions. It is
developed by the Astropy project but is intended to be general and
usable by any Python package.
dependencies.name: py-extension-helpers

dependencies.description: A specification for pythonic filesystems.
dependencies.name: py-fsspec

dependencies.description:
The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.
dependencies.name: py-h5py

dependencies.description: HTML parser based on the WHATWG HTML specification.
dependencies.name: py-html5lib

dependencies.description:
IPython provides a rich toolkit to help you make the most out of using
Python interactively.
dependencies.name: py-ipython

dependencies.description:
This package can load and use a Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL)
ephemeris for predicting the position and velocity of a planet or other
Solar System body.
dependencies.name: py-jplephem

dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.
dependencies.name: py-matplotlib

dependencies.description: A Python library for arbitrary-precision floating-point arithmetic.
dependencies.name: py-mpmath

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description: Core utilities for Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-packaging

dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.
dependencies.name: py-pandas

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the Python bindings.
dependencies.name: py-pyarrow

dependencies.description:
PyERFA is the Python wrapper for the ERFA library (Essential Routines
for Fundamental Astronomy), a C library containing key algorithms for
astronomy, which is based on the SOFA library published by the
International Astronomical Union (IAU). All C routines are wrapped as
Numpy universal functions, so that they can be called with scalar or
array inputs.
dependencies.name: py-pyerfa

dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.
dependencies.name: py-pytest

dependencies.description: Meta-package containing dependencies for testing.
dependencies.name: py-pytest-astropy

dependencies.description:
pytest plugin to add diagnostic information to the header of the test
output.
dependencies.name: py-pytest-astropy-header

dependencies.description: Pytest plugin with advanced doctest features.
dependencies.name: py-pytest-doctestplus

dependencies.description: py.test xdist plugin for distributed testing and loop-on-failing mode
dependencies.name: py-pytest-xdist

dependencies.description: World timezone definitions, modern and historical.
dependencies.name: py-pytz

dependencies.description: PyYAML is a YAML parser and emitter for Python.
dependencies.name: py-pyyaml

dependencies.description:
S3FS builds on aiobotocore to provide a convenient Python filesystem
interface for S3.
dependencies.name: py-s3fs

dependencies.description:
Image processing algorithms for SciPy, including IO, morphology,
filtering, warping, color manipulation, object detection, etc.
dependencies.name: py-scikit-image

dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-scipy

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm

dependencies.description:
Sorted Containers is an Apache2 licensed sorted collections library,
written in pure-Python, and fast as C-extensions.
dependencies.name: py-sortedcontainers

dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).
dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions

dependencies.description: A built-package format for Python.
dependencies.name: py-wheel

dependencies.description: The Python programming language.
dependencies.name: python

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependencies.description:
WCSLIB a C implementation of the coordinate transformations defined in
the FITS WCS papers.
dependencies.name: wcslib

dependent_to.description:
HEALPix (Hierarchical Equal Area isoLatitude Pixelisation) is an
algorithm for pixellizing a sphere that is sometimes used in Astronomy
to store data from all-sky surveys, but the general algorithm can apply
to any field that has to deal with representing data on a sphere.
dependent_to.name: py-astropy-healpix

dependent_to.description:
DXchange provides an interface with tomoPy and raw tomographic data
collected at different synchrotron facilities.
dependent_to.name: py-dxchange

dependent_to.description:
Tools for manipulating FITS images using primarily scipy & native python
routines
dependent_to.name: py-fits-tools

dependent_to.description: healpy is a Python package to handle pixelated data on the sphere.
dependent_to.name: py-healpy

dependent_to.description:
Photutils is an Astropy package for detection and photometry of
astronomical sources.
dependent_to.name: py-photutils

dependent_to.description:
PyCBC is a software package used to explore astrophysical sources of
gravitational waves. It contains algorithms to analyze gravitational-
wave data from the LIGO and Virgo detectors, detect coalescing compact
binaries, and measure the astrophysical parameters of detected sources.
PyCBC was used in the first direct detection of gravitational waves and
is used in the flagship analysis of LIGO and Virgo data.
dependent_to.name: py-pycbc

dependent_to.description:
Pulse is a package used to handle PSRFITS files and perform subsequent
analyses on pulse profiles.
dependent_to.name: py-pypulse

dependent_to.description:
pywcs is a set of routines for handling the FITS World Coordinate System
(WCS) standard.
dependent_to.name: py-pywcs

dependent_to.description:
The reproject package is a Python package to reproject astronomical
images using various techniques via a uniform interface. By
reprojection, we mean the re-gridding of images from one world
coordinate system to another (for example changing the pixel resolution,
orientation, coordinate system). Currently, we have implemented
reprojection of celestial images by interpolation (like SWARP), as well
as by finding the exact overlap between pixels on the celestial sphere
(like Montage). It can also reproject to/from HEALPIX projections by
relying on the astropy-healpix package.
dependent_to.name: py-reproject

dependent_to.description: SNCosmo is a Python library for high-level supernova cosmology analysis.
dependent_to.name: py-sncosmo

dependent_to.description:
Python code for calculating non-parametric morphological diagnostics of
galaxy images.
dependent_to.name: py-statmorph

dependent_to.description:
WCSAxes is a framework for making plots of Astronomical data in
Matplotlib.
dependent_to.name: py-wcsaxes

dependent_to.description:
Python library to read and process pulsar data in several different
formats
dependent_to.name: py-your

dependent_to.description:
Volumetric Data Analysis yt is a python package for analyzing and
visualizing volumetric, multi-resolution data from astrophysical
simulations, radio telescopes, and a burgeoning interdisciplinary
community.
dependent_to.name: py-yt

description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.
name: py-astropy

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
